comment: Very sweet woman who is always willing to go the extra mile in helping you to understand. She explains things very well and clearly knows her stuff! Even the more complicates aspects of German were very thoroughly taught and made simple. Also hilarious, she's got a good sense of humour.

I took Frau Wuertz-Hurley for my grammatical German course, a very hard class in general. However, she was willing to explain things in detail, and despite the course being fast paced, the entire class seemed to follow. She was also willing to sit and talk with those who had questions and tries to improve the class and asks students how she can

2003 is a very intensive course, hence the 6 credits. The workload is heavy but she is a very fair and understanding professor. If you have questions or issues, she is easily approachable and will work with you so long as you put in the effort. Attendance and class participation are both mandatory and part of the grade.

She is a very nice and very approachable professor. Her course load is pretty heavy but shes also very fair with taking late work and gives lots of various ways to easily improve grade. Youll have to participate and work for your grade, but its a language class! The advanced classes do have a lot of work, so be prepared! She expects your best!

I've taken her twice and I plan on taking her again. She is the sweetest professor I've ever heard. I could never imagine her being "condescending" like some of these reviews claim. She has a deep passion for teaching and it shows in her lectures. She assigns a good bit of homework but it is usually light weight and easy. Takes me like ten minutes.

I Stafanie's 1102 GRMN class last year and had a wonderful time. It was one of the few classes I was actually excited to go to because the professor was so kind and encouraging. I highly recommend her.

Class is in german, so be prepared! A ton of homework and there are optional quizzes that your class can vote to have. She can seem condescending, at times but does really care. Taking her again for 2003.
Can be condescending and make you feel stupid when asking how to say things. Reasonable grader and tries very hard. Very nice overall.

She's awesome. Extremely helpful and gives you great feedback. It's a fast paced class so try not to miss class. She will speak more German than English at times but it's helpful and she'll also revert back to English if we all look confused. Encourages you to use German as much as possible. DO THE HW! It's easy and only checked for participation.

I really enjoyed this course and this prof. She will mostly speak German with you so it is great for learning. The 2003 course everyday really helped solidify the material. I am going to take her again for sure. Test after every 2 chapters (moderate difficulty). Roleplays. Compositions. She really helps you understand everything till you get it.

This professor is very formal and strict, but has a very genuine desire to see her students do well. You will be required to put in a lot of work to get high grades, but if you have questions she is always willing to answer them. From speaking with other students, she seems to be much harder than other Professors, but you learn a lot more.

Don't take this class unless you enjoy feeling like you are in high school. She will also do nothing to help you out. If your grade situation is close and it is a life or death situation she will just say...nah. To be fair she isn't the worse professor, but she will not bump you up.
